page.title: 02Pakistani family, St Ives
page.content: This Pakistani family have settled in St Ives. They enjoy a Pakistani life style as far as possible. They buy special food from stores in Cambridge or Bedford although there is a van which delivers to their door, weekly. The ladies and girls in the family usually wear Pakistani clothes but the men wear Western style clothes to fit in with the men at work. The children are expected to behave as they would in Pakistan but the children researching this report thought the boys are given much more freedom than the girls, who are expected to run the home. They feel that everyone is treated the same in this country and that the health service and police work for both rich or poor. They like St Ives because it is clean, quiet and there are few racial difficulties.
